overview_summary: The landowner identified is a private family farm trust rather than a formal company. It appears to be an estate-planning vehicle holding farmland, with no public corporate filings or obvious community leadership role. This suggests low-profile ownership focused on family asset management rather than organized development activism.

neighbors.name: Forsberg Farm Trust
neighbors.claims: Forsberg Farm Trust is a private family trust likely created to hold and transfer farm assets across generations, rather than an active business entity [Harvest Law KC](https://harvestlawkc.com/should-farm-families-use-a-trust-for-estate-planning/). Kansas law does not require family land trusts to register as corporations, so the trust’s details (such as beneficiaries or trustees) are not publicly disclosed beyond land title records [Kansas Statutes §58-2401](https://www.ksrevisor.gov/statutes/chapters/ch58/058_024_0001.html). No evidence of commercial operations, political campaign contributions, or public statements by this trust was found in available records, indicating it has a limited public footprint.
neighbors.influence_justification: Small-scale farmland holder with no notable public or political profile

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the trust’s representative (family trustee or attorney) with respect and transparency about the project; emphasize long-term benefits (steady lease income, land stewardship) to address any concerns about losing agricultural use
